alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 10:23AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam release continues. * WHERE...Yukon River from Galena to Kaltag * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring along the Yukon River from Galena to Kaltag. Water is overbank into low lying areas along much of the Yukon River. Water may impact fish camps and other remote cabins along the river. In Galena, several roads are inundated with water. Sheds and other structures along lakes in the community are impacted by floodwaters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10 AM AKDT, A very large ice jam above Ruby that released on Sunday continues to send a surge of water and ice downriver. The large volume of water that was backed up behind this ice jam will take many days to drain so water levels on the Yukon will remain high for a number of days. Water levels have fallen nearly 3 feet in Ruby since Monday and are starting to crest in Galena Tuesday morning. As the flood crest moves downriver water levels will increase between Koyukuk and Kaltag through Wednesday, while continuing to receded at Galena and Ruby. - Flooding is not expected in Kaltag due to the higher elevation above the river. - For Yukon River at Ruby: At 8 am Tuesday the stage was 36.1 feet. Flood Stage is 40.0 feet. For Yukon River at Galena: At 7 am Tuesday the stage was 125.1 feet. Flood Stage is 124.0 feet. - http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon between Ruby and Kaltag prepare for minor flooding. Move valuables such as vehicles and boats out of low lying areas and store them on higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
